Title: Investments Intern
Required Qualifications:
Overview

Through the FM Global Investments internship program, you will gain exposure to multiple asset classes (Equities, Fixed Income, Alternatives). Candidates will work with Investments team members to develop various project deliverables. Internship projects will be allocated among interns appropriately. Interns will work closely with their assigned project mentor.

Responsibilities

Internship projects may include some of the following:
• Engage in various investment projects across asset classes and disciplines – Equities, Fixed Income, Alternatives and Operations
• Portfolio management investment and risk analytics – total portfolio and by asset class
• Developing investment management reports by asset class
• Weekly / monthly / quarterly markets and portfolio analytics packet for Equities and Fixed Income
• Working with Investments team members and Bloomberg subject matter experts to build broad markets and asset class-based screens
• Industry research analysis
• Security level analysis
• Other Investments and Operations related projects

Qualifications
• MBA with a strong academic record
• Strong quantitative and presentation tools expertise (Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)) very helpful for the internship work
• Experience with Bloomberg and FactSet a plus
• Strong quantitative skills and mindset
• Keen interest in learning aspects of investment management

Title: 2021 Investment Summer Intern - Master's Student
Required Qualifications:
Position Summary

The 2020 Summer Internship for Fixed Income Quantitative Research and Strategy in Guardian Life's Investments Department will focus primarily on fixed income quantitative analysis and how it is applied to the investment process.

This program provides an opportunity for the intern to utilize his/her programming skills (Python, R, VBA preferred), knowledge of fixed income securities and derivatives and analytical/statistical knowledge in the areas of model development, portfolio optimization and data analysis. Seeking Master’s student with relevant coursework in machine learning, big data and artificial intelligence would be a plus.

The intern(s) will also be exposed to multiple aspects of the Investment process through attendance at regular investment department meetings and through interfacing with various subject matter experts in the areas of corporate credit risk, structured finance, derivatives and of course quantitative research.

At the conclusion of the program, the intern would be expected to make a presentation discussing the various projects worked on during the internship.

Internship Overview

Our Internship Program is a paid 10-week learning experience where you will be immersed in the daily environment of a thriving Fortune 250 global financial services company.

You will gain invaluable industry and organizational knowledge through daily business interactions and job assignments, in addition to engaging in projects that directly affect our business, interact with senior leaders in conversational settings, and network with employees and interns across our regional offices.

Primary Location

United States-New York-New York

Job

Investments

Schedule

Full-time

Shift

Day Job

Job Type

Standard

Travel

Yes, 10 % of the Time

Job Posting

Oct 16, 2020, 10:11:27 AM

~Housing is not provided~

Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization. F-1 visa holders with Optional Practical Training (OPT) who will require H-1B status, TNs, or current H-1B visa holders will not be considered. H1-B and green card sponsorship is not available for this position.

About Guardian

Guardian has been helping people protect their futures and secure their lives for more than 150 years. Every day, we serve approximately 27 million people through a range of insurance and financial products. As one of the largest mutual insurance companies, we know what matters most: putting the needs of our customers first. Because everyone deserves a Guardian. Learn more about Guardian at guardianlife.com

Guardian is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, marital status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Title: Systematic Fixed Income Strategy Intern
Required Qualifications:
Company Profile

Founded in 1977, GMO is a private partnership committed to delivering superior investment performance and advice to our clients.  We offer strategies where we believe we are positioned to add the greatest value for our investors.  These include multi-asset class portfolios as well as dedicated equity, fixed income, and absolute return offerings, many of which employ the firm’s proprietary 7-year asset class forecasting framework.  Our client base is comprised primarily of institutions, including corporate and public defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, endowments, foundations, and financial intermediaries.

GMO, whose sole business is investment management, employs approximately 470 people worldwide and is headquartered in Boston with offices in San Francisco, London, Amsterdam, Sydney, and Singapore. We manage roughly $60 billion in client assets using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches that blend traditional fundamental insights with innovative quantitative methods to identify undervalued asset classes and securities. Our valuation-based approach embeds several key factors, including: a long-term investment horizon, discipline, conviction, and a commitment to research. Our research emphasizes not only identifying and exploiting pricing dislocations but also understanding the long-term drivers of return in the markets in which we invest. We are known for our candor in sharing our views with clients and for our willingness to take bold, differentiated positions when opportunities warrant.

Position Overview

The Systematic Fixed Income Strategy group is looking for a talented and driven individual to join our quantitative strategy efforts. The team is responsible for conducting research and establishing strategy across current Fixed Income capabilities and developing new strategies and products. Particular areas of focus are systematic credit capabilities in corporate credit, and the development of a framework to allocate risk across various sectors of fixed income in specific quantitative solutions projects.

The successful candidate will work on a number of projects related to the development of new systematic fixed income strategies. This would range from working with the team to develop quantitative fixed income solutions that combine existing capabilities, create factor and model attribution of existing strategies, and contribute to white papers and insight materials created by the team. He/she will develop critical insight in the development and management of fixed income strategies and gain exposure to multiple sectors of fixed income across emerging markets, corporate credit, and developed rates and currencies. This role offers insight into the investment product and strategy landscape in systematic fixed income more broadly. The individual will participate in research and project meetings and will be provided with opportunities to learn about and meet with other teams at GMO.

Department Profile

The Fixed Income team is responsible for managing portfolios and conducting research across all major sectors of fixed income and currencies. The team values clarity of roles and decision-making while maintaining a culture of intellectual curiosity, debate, respectful disagreement, candor, and collegiality.

Responsibilities
Conduct strategy and quantitative fixed income solutions research and design applying existing strategies and capabilities to meet specific investment needs
Create and enhance interactive tools for analysis and visualization of current fund and strategy positioning, performance and risk characteristics
Improve and extend connectivity on data and coding architecture and infrastructure within the fixed income and across other teams as appropriate.
Assist various members of the Fixed Income team with related research projects including contributing to white papers and broad research initiatives.

Profile And Requirements
Working on a degree in Computer Science, Quantitative finance, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering or similar
Hands-on experience with programming in Matlab, or another language like R, Python, Java, C# or Julia
Programming proficiency in SQL
Basic understanding of statistics and econometric concepts
Interest in understanding the sources of returns for major asset classes, signal construction, portfolio theory and translation from model to markets.
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, set goals and meet deadlines
Ability to work effectively and efficiently with moderate supervision
Effective verbal and written communication skills

Title: Corporate and Investment Banking Internship, Fixed Income Trading - 6 months
Required Qualifications:
Responsibilities

Societe Generale Global Markets Division (MARK) provides hard-working, talented graduates with the opportunity to develop exceptional careers within the finance industry. The Off Cycle Analyst Program provides exposure to large Fixed Income, Equity and Commodity trading floors as well as to our Prime Brokerage business and other banking activities. This 6 month Internship has a variety of opportunities across our New York office. The program will enable you to benefit from ongoing networking and development opportunities inside and outside of your assigned team.

Profile required

Program Benefits
• Opportunities in Equity, Fixed Income, and Prime Services, making markets in hundreds of financial products.
• Provide an insight into the day-to-day functioning of Capital Markets, and contribute firsthand the trading of global risk and capital flows
• Deep understanding of a wide range of trades implemented by key market investors across Global Banks, Hedge Funds Insurers, Pension funds, Real Money managers and Corporate Accounts
• Invaluable opportunity to demonstrate your potential in a competitive trading floor environment working for a ~$1.45tn asset global bank

Intern Responsibilities:
• Calculating value-at-risk figures for the trading strategies of prime brokerage clients
• Analyzing Trading Desk hedging strategies and risk exposures
• Deconstructing client trading behavior to find opportunities to further product reach
• Engaging clients directly in social settings to deepen client relationships

Business insight

Societe Generale is looking for students who maintain:
• Strong academic record
• Flexibility, innovative thinking, energy, drive and enthusiasm
• Exceptional interpersonal, communication and analytical skills
• Interest in financial markets and global geopolitics
• Ability to work effectively in both a team and independently

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, sexual or gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

Title: Summer 2021 Intern-Marketing
Required Qualifications:
About Commonfund
Commonfund was founded in 1971 as an independent asset management firm with a grant from the Ford Foundation. Together with or through its affiliates, Commonfund today manages customized investment programs for endowments, foundations and public pension funds. Among the pioneers in applying the endowment model of investing to institutional portfolios, we provide extensive investment flexibility using independent investment sub-advisers for discretionary and non-discretionary outsourcing engagements. Investment programs incorporate active and passive strategies in equities and fixed income, hedge funds, real assets and private capital. For additional information about Commonfund, please visit www.commonfund.org.

Asset Management Summer 2021 Intern: Marketing Department
Our marketing department supports the entire firm’s initiatives in a variety of ways including, sales presentations, event management, preparing marketing and research materials, along with managing the company website. This role will work closely with our team and focus on digital marketing projects. The intern will work with our HubSpot and BrightEdge platforms on marketing campaigns, social media and Search Engine Optimization (SEO), as well as reporting/analytics. This candidate should have an interest in online digital technologies (familiarity with html a plus) and be well-organized. This role is based in Wilton, CT.

How the intern program works:
The program runs for 10 weeks from June until August. We generally have a set start date in early June but are flexible for students on a different school schedule.  
This position will begin virtually and will be in person in our Wilton, CT office when we reopen. 
 A resume and cover letter are required for the application process.
Skills and attributes we look for:
A demonstrated interest in asset management, investments or capital markets
A strong proficiency with Microsoft Office programs including Excel, Word and PowerPoint
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong analytical/problem solving skills 
 To learn more about Commonfund, the program and to apply, go our website:  www.commonfund.org/careers

Title: Multi-Asset Research Analyst Intern
Required Qualifications:
Invesco is one of the world’s leading global investment managers, entrusted with managing $1.2 trillion* in assets on behalf of clients worldwide. We are the 6th largest US retail asset manager and the 13th largest investment manager globally, and our more than 8,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. We are purely focused on managing a comprehensive range of active, passive and alternative investment capabilities, which we draw on to provide customized solutions aligned to client needs, our most important benchmark. (*As of May 31,2019)

Job Purpose (Job Summary):
The team is seeking an intern who will focus on applied investment research in the fields of quantitative finance, asset allocation, global macro strategies, risk premia, factor strategies and portfolio construction. The successful candidate is expected to work on selected projects spanning multiple asset classes such as global equities, fixed income, credit, commodities, currencies, real estate and alternative investments.

Key Responsibilities / Duties:
• Perform empirical research using economic and financial data, applying regression and statistical analysis, building valuation and forecasting models for multiple asset classes, and back-testing of actionable investment strategies.
• Partner with research analysts within IIS to support investment research agenda.
• Develop systematic and discretionary investment strategies across asset classes, designing custom-solutions for diverse client objectives.
• Support research agenda outlined by senior management, following macro and quantitative research from sell-side firms, central banks, multilateral institutions and academic journals.
• Support the automation and streamlining of existing spreadsheets/processes

Work Experience / Knowledge:
• Excellent quantitative skills, with knowledge of applied statistics and econometrics.

Skills / Other Personal Attributes Required:
• Strong skills in Excel (including VBA) or statistical packages such as Matlab, Phyton, R, etc. and programming.
• Very attentive to details, and strong ability to efficiently organize large amounts of data.
• Strong drive, passion and curiosity to undertake investment research initiatives beyond assigned projects, contributing to the overall investment process also with own independent ideas.

Formal Education: (minimum requirement to perform job duties)
• Advanced degree in Economics, Finance, Applied statistics or other Quantitative Finance Disciplines.

FLSA (US Only): Nonexempt

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment

Title: Intern - Fixed Income
Required Qualifications:
Job Description

Primary Accountabilities/Responsibilities:
• Rotate through different sales and trading products and teams to understand and help find new ways of

creating efficiencies within day to day functions
• Responsible for learning fixed income products and market knowledge within agency MBS, debentures,

treasuries, corporates, municipalities, and ABS
• Entrepreneurial spirit and self-learning mentality
• Maintain prompt and regular attendance
• This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and can be expanded to include other

duties or responsibilities that management deems necessary.

Job Requirements
• BA or BS in a finance or economics related background
• Advanced in Excel and Bloomberg
• Programming skills are beneficial to assist with creation of new models and valuation tools
• Candidates for the program must possess a strong, ongoing interest in the financial markets with emphasis

on a dealer’s front-office Sales and Trading environment.
• Soft skills such as communication, teamwork, organization

About Us

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organizations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise. We provide access to 36 derivatives exchanges, 175 foreign exchange markets, nearly every global securities marketplace and a number of bi-lateral liquidity venues. We deliver this access with support throughout the entire lifecycle of a trade – from consulting and “boots-on-the-ground” intelligence, to best execution, to post-trade clearing, custody and settlement. In these ways, StoneX enables clients to use the global markets ecosystem to achieve their business goals through one trusted partner. We currently serve more than 30,000 commercial, institutional and payments clients, and more than 125,000 retail clients across more than 130 countries. Our clients use our institutional-grade digital platforms, our high-touch service, and our market intelligence to pursue trading opportunities, make investments efficiently, manage their market risks, and improve their business performance. Our relentless focus on helping them accomplish these objectives has enabled us to build deeply valued, long-term relationships based on guidance, integrity, transparency and trust.

Title: Investment Banking Intern
Required Qualifications:
CORPORATE PROFILE
Ziegler is a privately held investment bank, capital markets and proprietary investments firm. Specializing in the healthcare, senior living and education sectors, as well as general municipal and structured finance, enables us to generate a positive impact on the communities we serve. Headquartered in Chicago with regional and branch offices throughout the U.S., Ziegler provides its clients with capital raising, strategic advisory services, equity and fixed income sales & trading and research.

POSITION OVERVIEW
We are looking for a rising senior student to join our Corporate Finance Healthcare practice in Bethesda, MD for a summer intern position in our paid internship program. This program is designed to help give young professionals the opportunity to gain real-world experience at a dynamic investment bank!  

Ziegler’s expertise in our respective sectors is unsurpassed. Summer associates will have the opportunity to work with our experienced bankers, financial advisors and associates. They will have exposure to market and industry research projects, as well as detailed financial analysis. It’s an experience you’ll never find in a classroom! 

DETAILS
Internships generally start at the beginning of summer and end upon your return to school in the fall. These are full-time opportunities paid at $15.00 an hour. 

Responsibilities may include but are not limited to: 
Conduct financial statement and ratio analysis 
Research and develop competitor, market and industry reports 
Assist in credit analysis and conduct data analysis of tax-exempt bond issuance 
Provide sector analysis, update existing internal records and conduct financial data analysis 
Data collection and editing in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint 
Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS
Candidates must be a senior at an accredited university
Candidates are preferred with a finance, sales or general business major 
Candidate must pass all pre-hire background checks including criminal, credit and reference checks 
Ability to work well independently and within a team
Ability to manage multiple tasks and complete quickly with accuracy
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical and project management skills
Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Suite

Ziegler is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

Title: 2021 SSGA - Graduate Summer Intern - FICC Beta PM
Required Qualifications:
• Please note- this role is for current (enrolled in Summer 2021) graduate students that are able to work in Boston, MA*

Job Description

POSITION PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Uses communication & interpersonal skills to communicate quantitative concepts, model and research outputs to portfolio management teams and other investment audiences.
